informal_statement: Compute $29^{13} - 5^{13}$ modulo 7. Show that it is 3.
informal_proof: Firstly, note that $29 \equiv 1$ modulo 7, so $29^{13} \equiv 1$ modulo 7. Also, $5 \equiv (-2)$, so $1 - 5^{13} \equiv 1 + 2^{13}$ modulo 7. Finally, $2^3 \equiv 1$ modulo 7, so $2^{13} \equiv 2(2^3)^4 \equiv 2 \cdot 1 \equiv 2$. Thus $29^{13} - 5^{13} \equiv 1+2 \equiv 3$ modulo 7.
formal_code:
(*
  Authors: Wenda Li

theory mathd_numbertheory_728 imports 
  Complex_Main 
  "HOL-Computational_Algebra.Computational_Algebra"
begin

theorem mathd_numbertheory_728:
  "(29^13 - 5^13) mod 7 = (3::nat)"
  sorry 

end
